title: conferred on me by section 42 of the Public Service Pay and Pensions Act
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Public Service Pay and Pensions
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Public Service Pay and Pensions 
Act 2017 (Section 42) (Payments to General Practitioners) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2024.

title: conferred on me by section 42 of the Public Service Pay and Pensions Act
heading: In these Regulations—
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations— 

“Principal Regulations” means the Public Service Pay and Pensions Act 2017 
(Section 42) (Payments to General Practitioners) Regulations 2019 (S.I. No. 
692 of 2019) as amended.

heading: Amount payable to a general practitioner for
text_raw:
3. 

Amount payable to a general practitioner for 
administering to an individual a vaccine in situations of 
disease outbreak in a specific area in the State 

Amount payable to a general practitioner for 
administering to an individual a vaccine during a 
pandemic 

Amount payable to a general practitioner under the 
General Medical Services Scheme for administering a 
full course of vaccines against Hepatitis B, including 
post-vaccination testing where necessary, to an individual 

€142.57 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 29th March, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4.

conferred on me by section 42 of the Public Service Pay and Pensions Act
text_raw:
9. 

[120] 3 

€28.50 

in an at-risk category 

Amount payable to a general practitioner for 
administering a PPV vaccine to an individual in an at-risk 
category under the General Medical Services Scheme 
provided that the vaccine which is administered is not 
administered by the general practitioner (or by another 
general practitioner in the same practice) on the same day 
as an influenza vaccine 

Amount payable to a general practitioner for 
administering an influenza vaccine to an individual in an 
at-risk category, provided that the vaccine which is 
administered is not administered by the general 
practitioner (or by another general practitioner in the 
same practice) on the same day as a PPV vaccine 

€15.00 

Additional amount payable to a general practitioner for 
every ten individuals in an at-risk category to whom that 
general practitioner has administered an influenza 
vaccine, provided that the vaccines which were 
administered were not administered by the general 
practitioner (or by another general practitioner in the 
same practice) on the same day as a PPV vaccine 

€100.00 

Amount payable to a general practitioner for 
administering an influenza vaccine to an individual in an 
at-risk category – 

€42.75 

(a) a PPV, and 

(b) an influenza vaccine, 

under the General Medical Services Scheme where both 
vaccines are administered on the same day by the general 
practitioner or by the general practitioner concerned and 
another general practitioner in the same practice 

Amount payable to a general practitioner for 
administering a Live Attenuated Influenza Vaccine 
(LAIV) to a child aged 2 years or more and less than 18 
years, provided that the vaccine which is administered is 
not administered by the general practitioner (or by 
another general practitioner in the same practice) on the 
same day as a PPV vaccine 

€20.00 

Additional amount payable to a general practitioner for 
every ten children aged 2 years or more and less than 18 
years to whom that general practitioner has administered 
a Live Attenuated Influenza Vaccine (LAIV), provided 
that the vaccines which were administered were not 
administered by the general practitioner (or by another 
general practitioner in the same practice) on the same day 

€150.00

heading: as a PPV vaccine
text_raw:
12. 

as a PPV vaccine 

Amount payable to a general practitioner for 
administering an MMR vaccine to a child provided that 
the vaccine has not been administered under the Primary 
Childhood Immunisation Programme 

€36.03 

Amount payable to a general practitioner for every child 
to whom that general practitioner has administered an 
MMR vaccine in a dedicated catch-up vaccination clinic 

€6.00 

Amount payable to a general practitioner for 
administering an MMR vaccine to an adult 

€36.03 

” 

The Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development Plan Delivery and 
Reform, consents to the foregoing Regulations. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister 
for Public Expenditure, National Development 
Plan Delivery and Reform, 

8 March, 2024. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development 
Plan Delivery and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

27 March, 2024. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health.

title: conferred on me by section 42 of the Public Service Pay and Pensions Act
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Regulation amends the Public Service Pay and Pensions Act 2017 
(Section 42) (Payments to General Practitioners) Regulations 2019 (S.I. No. 
692 of 2019) to provide a fee for General Practitioners for the provision of 
MMR vaccinations.
